title: [Large-scale] Creative Thinking Development Based on the Allen Hopper Model: Integrated Mathematics and Engineering Course

context.prior_knowledge: College-level mathematics and foundational engineering knowledge
context.additional_context: Creative thinking training program in blended settings, combining digital tools and offline workshops to prioritize real-world problem-solving.

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to creatively solve complex mathematical/engineering problems by applying the five stages of Allen Hopper’s model: problem definition, idea generation, evaluation, revision, and implementation.
Apply over ten strategy tools based on Bloom’s cognitive domain taxonomy (analysis, evaluation, creation) to real-world cases.
Conduct idea development and critical feedback processes within small groups using digital collaboration tools (e.g., Miro, Padlet).
Develop an integrated approach combining mathematical modeling with engineering design problems.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
